metadata.title: CVE-2018-10545 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in PHP before 5.6.35, 7.0.x before 7.0.29, 7.1.xbefore 7.1.16, and 7.2.x before 7.2.4. Dumpable FPM child processes allowbypassing opcache access controls because fpm_unix.c makes aPR_SET_DUMPABLE prctl call, allowing one user (in a multiuser environment)to obtain sensitive information from the process memory of a second user'sPHP applications by running gcore on the PID of the PHP-FPM worker process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.25').
